statistics.description: The number of points scored.

statistics.description: Field Goal makes and attempts.

statistics.name: freeThrows
statistics.description: Free Throw makes and attempts.

statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.name: turnovers
statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.

statistics.name: minutes
statistics.description: The total number of minutes played.

statistics.name: assistTurnoverRatio
statistics.description: The average number of assists a player or team records per turnover

statistics.name: rebounds
statistics.description: The total number of rebounds (offensive and defensive).

statistics.name: defensiveRebounds
statistics.description: The number of times when the defense obtains the possession of the ball after a missed shot by the offense.

statistics.name: offensiveRebounds
statistics.description: The number of times when the offense obtains the possession of the ball after a missed shot.

article.headline: Hartford 50, Stony Brook 47
article.story: WEST HARTFORD, Conn. (AP) -- Jaret Von Rosenberg scored 21 points, 18 of them in the second half, to lead Hartford to a 50-47 victory over Stony Brook on Saturday. Bo Taylor scored 13 points, while Alex Zimnickas finished with nine points for Hartford (9-7). Ricky Lucas led Stony Brook (6-10) with 11 points and seven rebounds. Stony Brook dominated the first half, taking a 13-4 lead in the first seven minutes. Hartford closed the gap to 15-10 on a Zimnickas basket with 9:41 left in the half, but Stony Brook pulled away again. A Mike Popoko basket gave Stony Brook a 23-13 lead with 1:45 left in the half. Von Rosenberg responded with a 3-pointer after a Hartford time out with less than 30 seconds left, but Ryan Jones ended the half with a short jumper that gave Stony Brook a 25-16 lead. The score was tied five times in the second half, though the Hawks trailed most of the game. They didn't take their first lead until Von Rosenberg made two free throws with 8:28 left to give Hartford a 37-35 lead. The Hawks took the lead for good on Von Rosenberg's fourth 3-pointer with 3:07 left, giving Hartford a 47-44 lead. Stony Brook almost sent the game into overtime when a 3-point attempt by Lucas hit the rim's right side at the buzzer. Hartford shot only 22 percent (6-for-27) from the floor in the first half, while Stony Brook shot 45 percent (9-for-20). Hartford played its second game without starting guard Rich Baker, who is out with a fractured foot and not expected back for the next several games.
